code: @Manual{,   title = {sparseNumeric: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Utilities},   author = {Santhoshi Penmetsa},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/santhoshipen/sparseNumeric}, }

what: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Utilities
title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Utilities
text: sparseNumeric package implements S4 class sparse_numeric stores non-zero entries numeric vector along positions, tracking full length vector. representation useful working sparse numeric data efficiently. package provides: sparse_numeric S4 class validity checks coercion base R numeric arithmetic operations (+, -, *) via sparse_add, sparse_sub,sparse_mult, sparse_crossprod methods mean(), L2 norm(), standardize() custom show() plot() methods sparse vectors

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Utilities
text: can install development version sparseNumeric like : local clone repository: repository GitHub, can install :
code: # in the sparseNumeric project directory # devtools::install() # install.packages("devtools") # devtools::install_github("santhoshipen/sparseNumeric")

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class and Utilities
text: basic example shows solve common problem: Load package:
code: library(sparseNumeric) #>  #> Attaching package: 'sparseNumeric' #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     norm ## basic example code  # Create a sparse_numeric object  x_dense <- c(0, 0, 3, 0, 5) x <- as(x_dense, "sparse_numeric") x #> Sparse numeric (length5) #> Non-zero elements: 2  #> Positions: 3, 5 #> Values:    3, 5  # Mean  mean(x) #> [1] 1.6  # L2 Norm  norm(x) #> [1] 5.830952  # Standardization  standardize(x) #> [1] -0.6949956 -0.6949956  0.6081211 -0.6949956  1.4768656  # Arithmetic with another sparse vector y_dense <- c(1, 0, 3, 0, 2) y <- as(y_dense, "sparse_numeric")  as(x + y, "numeric") #> [1] 1 0 6 0 7 as(x - y, "numeric") #> [1] -1  0  0  0  3 as(x * y, "numeric") #> [1]  0  0  9  0 10  # Plot overlapping non-zero positions plot(x, y)

title: Arithmetic, display, and plot methods for sparse_numeric — +,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
code: # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 + e2  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 - e2  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 * e2  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' show(object)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' plot(   x,   y,   main = "Overlapping non-zero elements",   xlab = "Position",   ylab = "Value",   ... )
